alert.note: Alert for DeWitt; Gonzales; Karnes; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 8:14AM CDT until May 13 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR DEWITT, SOUTHERN GONZALES, KARNES AND WESTERN LAVACA COUNTIES... At 814 AM CDT, Radar and automated gauges continue indicate thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Local law enforcement and TXDOT officials are reporting flooded roadways in portions of southern Gonzales, DeWitt, and Karnes Counties. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cuero, Gonzales, Yoakum, Kenedy, Karnes City, Yorktown, Shiner, Moulton, Runge, Falls City, Smiley, Nordheim, Westhoff, Cheapside, Gillett, Hochheim, Cestohowa, Sample, Gruenau and New Davy. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
